title: [K-12] Machining Mechanics Modeling: Data-Driven Discovery and Application of Physical Laws

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Differential Equations, Basic Mechanical Engineering, and Machine Learning Algorithms
context.additional_context: Learners engage in real-time lectures and online discussions in BYOD environments, measuring learning outcomes through project-based assessment. Targets general citizens with advanced domain expertise

learning_goals: Learners can explain how to interpret the physical laws of machining mechanics using data-driven machine learning models
Learners can build machining mechanics simulation models using differential algebraic equations
Learners can analyze nonlinear characteristics such as process damping and edge forces in noisy experimental data
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
